data.title: Update languages
data.body:
### Requirements

* Filling out the template is required. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion.
* All new code requires tests to ensure against regressions

### Description of the Change

* language-c
  * Vastly improved preprocessor support
  * Digit separator support
  * Access operator fixes
* language-clojure
  * Fixed TODO highlighting in comments
* language-coffee-script
  * Auto-indent after a colon
* language-html
  * Auto-indentation fix
* language-java
  * Improved number support
  * Fixed qualified storage type highlighting
* language-javascript
  * Support SQL template strings
  * More JSDoc enhancements
* language-php
  * Add a shorthand echo snippet
* language-python
  * Allow spaces in firstline shebang
* language-ruby
  * Support embedded GraphQL
  * Support `group` and `ruby` keywords
* language-ruby-on-rails
  * Add assert_template snippet
* language-sql
  * Support `IF EXISTS`
* language-xml
  * Add another filetype
* language-yaml
  * Better overall highlighting

### Alternate Designs

None.

### Why Should This Be In Core?

Just updating some packages.

### Benefits

See above.

### Possible Drawbacks

Syntax highlighting regressions.

### Applicable Issues

None.

data.title: Run `script/lint` also on AppVeyor and Travis
data.body: /cc: @damieng

data.title: Normalize disk drive letter in path on Windows
data.body:
### Description of the Change

Currently atom creates two buffers for the same file if passed paths use difference case for disk drive letter, e.g. `d:\file.txt` and `D:\file.txt`

This change ensures that the absolute path always has disk drive letter in uppercase. 

### Alternate Designs

The other place where this fix could be applied is [findBufferForPath](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/project.coffee#L331) function. However the used function [resolvePath](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/project.coffee#L229) already has some path normalization code, so I think this is the best fit.

Actually Windows interpreters `file.txt` and `File.txt` as the same file. Maybe it makes sense to extend this patch and make Atom to do the same on this operation system, but I'm not sure because it can be file system specific. Any suggestions are welcome!

### Why Should This Be In Core?

I believe the current behavior of the editor is wrong for Windows users, so it makes no sense to create a plugin to fix that.

### Benefits

The main benefit I would like to get is the ability to click on parsed backtrace in my terminal emulation app (ConEmu). Right now it works, but atom opens second buffer for the same file because it doesn't normalize disk drive letter.

### Possible Drawbacks

The possible drawback is some broken tests, but I've checked that and it seems everything works.

### Applicable Issues

Here is the related issue #8221. It's not exactly about my problem, but it's very near.

data.title: :memo: :fire: broken TextEditorElement link
data.body:
Remove the link to the `TextEditorElement` class since it isn't documented and we don't intend it to be.

Fixes atom/flight-manual.atom.io#128

Stay secure :-)

data.title: Allow custom directory search providers to also override replace
data.body:
This change allows providers of `atom.directory-searcher` to provide a custom `replace` method to override the default `scandal`-based replacement logic, and moves the existing replacement logic into the default `DirectorySearch` provider.

For example, in Nuclide, we provide a custom directory searcher to enable searching remote files. However, remote file replacement is naturally still broken.

As a temporary workaround we ended up monkey-patching `atom.workspace.replace` (cc @zertosh): https://github.com/facebook/nuclide/blob/master/pkg/nuclide-remote-projects/lib/patchAtomWorkspaceReplace.js#L41

This will allow us to remove the hack and add the necessary code to our custom remote directory search provider instead.

Released under CC0.

data.title: With invisibles on, hard tabs render larger than they should
data.body: ### Prerequisites * [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/ * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages ### Description With `editor.showInvisibles` set to `true` and `editor.tabType` set to `hard`, tabs render one character larger than they should: Setting `editor.showInvisibles` to `false` corrects the problem: ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Launch Atom in your local atom repository 2. Open Settings View using Cmd+, on macOS or Ctrl+, on other platforms 3. Click the Editor tab 1. Check "Show Invisibles" 1. Set "Tab Type" to "hard" 1. Set "Tab Length" to 6 1. Open a new file using Cmd+N on macOS or Ctrl+N on other platforms 1. Type `1234567890` on the first line and press Enter 1. Press Tab on the second line **Expected behavior:** The cursor to align between the 6 and the 7 from the line above **Actual behavior:** The cursor aligns between the 7 and the 8 from the line above ### Versions ``` Atom : 1.15.0-dev-7e7224c67 Electron: 1.3.13 Chrome : 52.0.2743.82 Node : 6.5.0 ``` ### Additional Information `config.cson` ```coffee "*": "advanced-new-file": suggestCurrentFilePath: true "advanced-open-file": createFileInstantly: true "atom-color-highlight": hideMarkersInComments: true hideMarkersInStrings: true markersAtEndOfLine: true "autocomplete-elixir": elixirPath: "/usr/local/bin/elixir" erlangHome: "/usr/local/lib/erlang/bin" "autocomplete-erlang": elixirPath: "/usr/local/bin/elixir" "autocomplete-plus": confirmCompletion: "tab" defaultProvider: "Fuzzy" scopeBlacklist: [ ".string .comment" ] core: audioBeep: false customFileTypes: "source.git-config": [ "gitconfig" ] "source.ini": [ ".flowconfig" ] "source.ruby": [ "Brewfile" ] "text.slim": [ "slime" ] "text.xml.plist": [ "plist" ] disabledPackages: [ "background-tips" "fonts" ] followSymlinks: true ignoredNames: [ ".git" ".hg" ".svn" ".DS_Store" ".keep" "._*" "*.pyc" "Thumbs.db" ] openEmptyEditorOnStart: false projectHome: "/Users/Lee/Source" telemetryConsent: "limited" themes: [ "one-light-ui" "one-light-syntax" ] editor: fontFamily: "Anonymous Pro" fontSize: 16 invisibles: cr: "↩" eol: " " tab: "⇥" preferredLineLength: 100 scrollPastEnd: true showInvisibles: true tabLength: 4 tabType: "hard" "find-and-replace": scrollToResultOnLiveSearch: true fonts: fontFamily: "Anonymous Pro" "fortune-background-tips": fortuneCommand: "fortune -s Computers" "fuzzy-finder": preserveLastSearch: true "highlight-selected": showInStatusBar: false "markdown-preview": openPreviewInSplitPane: false useGitHubStyle: true "markdown-table-formatter": formatOnSave: false minimap: charHeight: 4 charWidth: 2 ignoreWhitespacesInTokens: true plugins: cursorline: true cursorlineDecorationsZIndex: 0 "find-and-replace": true "package-generator": createInDevMode: true pigments: ignoredScopes: [ "\\.elixir" ] markerType: "dot" "spell-check": {} "status-bar": cursorPositionFormat: "L:%L C:%C" fullWidth: false tabs: enableVcsColoring: true "tabs-to-spaces": changeSoftTabsMode: true onSave: "untabify" "tree-view": hideIgnoredNames: true hideVcsIgnoredFiles: true welcome: showOnStartup: false ".asciidoc.source": editor: softWrap: true "wrap-guide": enabled: false ".c.source": editor: tabLength: 4 ".cpp.source": editor: tabLength: 4 ".gfm.source": editor: showInvisibles: false softWrap: true tabLength: 4 "wrap-guide": enabled: false ".git-commit.text": editor: preferredLineLength: 72 ".haml.text": "wrap-guide": enabled: false ".java.source": editor: tabLength: 4 ".json.source": "wrap-guide": enabled: false ".python.regexp.source": editor: tabLength: 4 ".python.source": editor: tabLength: 4 ```

data.title: Add ContextMenuManager.remove
data.body:
### Description of the Change

This will add a `remove` method to `atom.contextMenu` to counter the `add` method

With this method one will be able to remove items from the context menu by specifying a selector(s) and label(s)

### Why Should This Be In Core?

Because the only alternative is to override a global object `atom.contextMenu`

### Benefits

This will finally give the ability to remove items that clutter the context menus from packages.
Similar to the benefits of disabling keybindings that packages automatically add

### Possible Drawbacks

None that I can think of.

### Applicable Issues

#9429
#7739

data.title: "Editor has crashed"
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [ X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Error message "The editor has crashed" with options to close window, reload, keep window open.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open from command line or from Ubuntu launcher
2. 
3. 

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]

Atom opens.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]

Atom crashes.

**Reproduces how often:** [What percentage of the time does it reproduce?]

100%

### Versions
Atom    : 1.13.1
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0apm  1.14.1
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.6
git 1.9.1


### Additional Information

I have tried launching --safe and --clear-window-state to no avail.  Uninstalled then reinstalled after rebooting my computer, also with no change.

Note: I powered down my computer while atom was still running previous to this crash.  :/

OS: Manjaro 16.10.3
Atom: 1.13.1

data.title: Error copy paste Ubuntu 12
data.body:
Hi,

I just installed atom in a distribution of ubuntu 12. I do not know if the error is from my computer or atom, but I can not copy or paste text.

Thanks you very much

data.title: Atom crashes when opening file
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * [X] Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode

### Description

[Description of the issue]
When "Open File..." "Open Folder..." "Add Project Folder..." any time when open file dialog should show, Atom exits.
In Safe Mode exits anyway.

### Steps to Reproduce

Anytime when trying to open something. On menu or press Ctrl O, Shift Ctrl O...

**Expected behavior:**  open file normally

**Actual behavior:** crashes and exits

**Reproduces how often:** Always
### Versions

C:\Users\Kasumi>atom --version

Atom    : 1.13.1
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0

C:\Users\Kasumi>apm --version
apm  1.14.1
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 3.6.0
git 2.11.0.windows.3
visual studio

Windows 10 x64 Enterprise ver.1607 14393.693

### Additional Information

Any additional information, configuration or data that might be necessary to reproduce the issue.
[operation_log.txt](https://github.com/atom/atom/files/752095/operation_log.txt)

data.title: Atom Beta 1.14 TextEditor.getPath() has inconsistent behavior with symlinks
data.body:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a project in `/var/myproject`, which is symlinked from `/private/var/myproject`.
2. Add a file `/var/myproject/main.js`
3. `cd /var/myproject && atom main.js`
4. Open the devtools console and run: `atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor().getPath()`
5. On atom 14 this is `/var/myproject/main.js`, on atom 13 it is `/private/var/myproject/main.js`

The behavior is actually even more inconsistent than this.  Here are four different examples:

Launch 1.13 from spotlight -> getPath() doesn't resolve symlink
Launch 1.14 from spotlight -> getPath() does resolve symlink
Launch 1.13 from command line -> getPath() does resolve symlink
Launch 1.14 from command line -> getPath() doesn't resolve symlink

### Expected behavior 

Ideally the `getPath()` API would have consistent behavior in all these cases, and this would be to always resolve symlinks.

### Reproduces how often

100% of the times that I tried.

### Versions

apm  1.14.1
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.0-rc2

MacOS Sierra 10.12.3

data.title: Atom goes black when moved to another monitor
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Screen goes black when moved off monitor which Atom was opened on. Sometimes if "Open in New Window" causes the window to automatically appear on a different monitor, then it is fine. But moving a screen originating from one monitor always causes it to go black when moved to another.

![img_20170203_133837](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4989650/22605678/927c1822-ea16-11e6-9645-05aa80981626.jpg)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom
2. Right click file and go to "Open in New Window"
3. Drag screen to other monitor.

**Expected behavior:** Screen looks normal.

**Actual behavior:** Screen is black.

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

Atom 1.13.1
Xubuntu 14.04.5 LTS kernel 4.4.0-57-generic nvidia drivers
8 monitors, 4 GeForce GTS 550 Ti

data.title: Assigning editor's height explicitly via position: 'absolute' deprecation when pane split right with new editor
data.body:
### Description

Hi, @franklinrt logged https://github.com/mupchrch/split-diff/issues/91. Atom core is throwing a deprecation warning when running `atom.workspace.paneForItem(atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor()).splitRight({items:[atom.workspace.buildTextEditor()]})` in my package. This seems like a reasonable bit of code to run, so I am logging this issue.

### Steps to Reproduce

I just updated Atom to 1.13.1 and I am getting a deprecation warning from Atom API code that seems reasonable.

Step 1: Open Atom
Step 2: run `atom.workspace.paneForItem(atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor()).splitRight({items:[atom.workspace.buildTextEditor()]})` in dev tools console

At this point I receive the following deprecation warning:

```atom core (1 deprecation)

Assigning editor 302's height explicitly via position: 'absolute' and an assigned top and bottom implicitly assigns the autoHeight property to false on the editor. This behavior is deprecated and will not be supported in the future. Please explicitly assign autoHeight on this editor.

TextEditorComponent.measureDimensions - /usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-component.js:1011:20

TextEditorComponent.becameVisible - /usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-component.js:295:12

TextEditorComponent.checkForVisibilityChange - /usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-component.js:993:16

atom-text-editor.attachedCallback - /usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-element.js:87:22

atom-pane-axis.childAdded - /usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/pane-axis-element.js:95:12

Function.module.exports.Emitter.simpleDispatch - /usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:25:14
```

data.title: Lag since 1.13.1
data.body:
Hi,

the recent update kinda broke the editor for me under Windows 10. It keeps freezing randomly after typing 2-3 chars and gets back after 3-5 secs.

data.title: rpm installation of atom in centos7 causes errors for some packages
data.body:
On centos 7 with Atom 1.13.0x64 the following warning is thrown when the autocomplete-python package first attempts to autocomplete.

```
/bin/sh: module: line 1: syntax error: unexpected end of file
/bin/sh: error importing function definition for `BASH_FUNC_module'
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install Centos7
2. Install atom with the 1.13.0 rpm
1. Install autocomplete-python package
2. Close Atom
3. Open Atom
4. Open python file
5. Start typing something that might trigger autocomplete

**Expected behavior:**
autocomplete dialogue appears, no warnings are thrown

**Actual behavior:**
no dialogue appears the warning/error is thrown

As far as I can tell this is an issue with the atom rpm install for fedora/centos.

After running
```
rpm -Uvh atom.x84_64.rpm
```
I can now find 2 copies of the atom executable one at `/bin/atom` and one at `/usr/share/atom/atom`. I would typically expect one of those to be a symlink to the other but that is not the case here. The desktop icon that the rpm adds to Gnome is pointed at the executable `/usr/share/atom/atom `

If I run atom from the command line with `/usr/share/atom/atom` I get the following error
```
bash: cannot set terminal process group (-1): Inappropriate ioctl for device
bash: no job control in this shell
```
and the `BASH_FUNC_module` error for autocomplete-python persists. So you obviously see this same behaviour with the desktop icon.

If I run atom with `/bin/atom` there are no errors and everything works as expected.

### Current Solutions

Either

1. Run atom from the commandline allowing it to resolve to `/bin/atom`
2. As I'm using gnome I changed the atom desktop icon to always call `/bin/atom` is called. I made the following edits to `/usr/share/applications/atom.desktop`
```
Exec=/bin/atom %F
Icon=/usr/share/atom/atom.png
```
and then log out and back in to Gnome

data.title: :arrow_up: coffee-script
data.body:
Just a friendly reminder to occasionally update coffee-script.

Allows new syntax to be used and also provides better source maps.

After merging, make sure to clear compile-cache for updated source maps to take effect.

Changelogs can be found at http://coffeescript.org/#1.12.0 and then by scrolling up.

data.title: adjacent .atom folder not recongnized with portable zip distribution.
data.body:
<!--

Have you read Atom's Code of Conduct? By filing an Issue, you are expected to comply with it, including treating everyone with respect: https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

Do you want to ask a question? Are you looking for support? The Atom message board is the best place for getting support: https://discuss.atom.io

-->

### Prerequisites

* [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

new portable mode that was introduced with 1.14beta0 got broken with later betas

### Steps to Reproduce

1. download [https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/download/v1.14.0-beta3/atom-x64-windows.zip](https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/download/v1.14.0-beta3/atom-x64-windows.zip)
2. extract to a folder and create a .atom folder adjacent to **atom.exe** file
3. start and made some changes, install packages etc.

**Expected behavior:**
atom should user this adjacent **.atom** folder for packages

**Actual behavior:**
atom uses .atom folder from user profile folder not adjacent **.atom** folder.

**Reproduces how often:**
tried in two computers. same result

### Versions
1.14.0-beta3

### Additional Information
this new portable mode was working with 1.14.0-beta0

data.title: Open a new file from terminal from same project, clears old tabs and unsaved buffer from that project
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * [x] Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * [x] Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * [x] Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * [x] Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * [x] Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description
Open a new file from terminal from same project, clears old tabs and unsaved buffer from that project

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a project in terminal with `atom .`
2. Open a file and modify it, don't save.
3. Close Atom(this won't repro if there's other atom windows open.  Only if all Atom instances are closed)
4. On the same directory in terminal, do `atom <new file name>`


**Actual**: Atom opens new file with the current folder.  The changes on the file that was modify in step 2 are gone.  When you close Atom and reopen with `atom .` or opening recent projects, it shows the new file from step 4 only.

**Expected**: old tabs and unsaved changes should exist(if there are any) and new file should open in new tab 

**Reproduces how often:** 100% if you don't have another atom instance open, If you do, the new file will be opened there.

### Versions

```
atom --version
Atom    : 1.13.1
Electron: 1.3.13
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.5.0
```

```
apm --version
apm  1.14.1
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.10
git 2.10.1
```

This issue was found while testing https://github.com/atom/tabs/issues/306#issuecomment-276861137

data.title: Atom v1.12.0 breaks hotkeys.
data.body:
### Description

#### Atom v1.12.0 breaks hotkeys.
I have dvorak-qwerty keyboard https://sourceforge.net/projects/dvorakqwerty/
It means layout on dvorak, but hotkeys like on qwerty. (Ctrl + C, and ...) working well in every apps, exclude Photoshop -_-.

But atom's update from 1.11.2 (working), to 1.12.0 (not working) breaks this hotkeys.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install layout
2. Install atom

**Expected behavior:** hotkeys shoud work well.

**Actual behavior:** They doesn't work well =(. I have to press Ctrl + I for copy something (C on dvorak === I on qwerty)

### Versions

Windows 10

data.title: Setting invisibles property "space" causes Atom error
data.body:
Atom appears to not like the following setting in `config.cson`:
```
invisibles:
  space: false
```
The [other three](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/config-schema.js#L456-L480) properties give me no problem.

The error might be a duplicate of #12294.

**Atom Version**: 1.13.1
**Electron Version**: 1.3.13
**System**: Ubuntu 16.10
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: this.invisibles.space.repeat is not a function

```
At /opt/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/display-layer.js:1331

TypeError: this.invisibles.space.repeat is not a function
    at DisplayLayer.module.exports.DisplayLayer.buildTokenText (/opt/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/display-layer.js:1331:38)
    at DisplayLayer.module.exports.DisplayLayer.getScreenLines (/opt/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/display-layer.js:1224:37)
    at TextEditorPresenter.<anonymous> (/opt/atom/resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-presenter.js:1356:36)
    at TextEditorPresenter.module.exports.TextEditorPresenter.updateLines (/opt/atom/resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-presenter.js:1363:12)
    at TextEditorPresenter.module.exports.TextEditorPresenter.getPreMeasurementState (/opt/atom/resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-presenter.js:123:12)
    at TextEditorComponent.module.exports.TextEditorComponent.updateSyncPreMeasurement (/opt/atom/resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-component.js:264:60)
    at TextEditorComponent.module.exports.TextEditorComponent.updateSync (/opt/atom/resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-component.js:196:12)
    at /opt/atom/resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-component.js:323:28
    at ViewRegistry.module.exports.ViewRegistry.performDocumentUpdate (/opt/atom/resources/app.asar/src/view-registry.js:219:9)
    at /opt/atom/resources/app.asar/src/view-registry.js:3:59
```
